OVERVIEW:
MLRA(s): 153B
MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Raleigh, North Carolina
Depth Class: Very deep
Drainage Class: Very poorly drained
Permeability: Moderate
Surface Runoff: Slow to ponded
Parent Material: Loamy marine sediments
Slope: 0 to 2 percent
Mean Annual Air Temperature (type location): 62 degrees F.
Mean Annual Precipitation (type location): 48 inches

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Coarse-silty, mixed, semiactive, acid, thermic Typic Humaquepts

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Weeksville loam - cultivated. (Colors are for moist soil)
Ap--0 to 6 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) loam; moderate medium granular structure; friable; common fine roots; very strongly acid; gradual smooth boundary. (5 to 7 inches thick)
AB--6 to 13 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; few fine roots; very strongly acid; gradual smooth boundary. (5 to 12 inches thick)
Bg1--13 to 32 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; few fine flakes of mica; very strongly acid; gradual smooth boundary.
Bg2--32 to 38 inches; dark grayish brown (2.5Y 4/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; few fine flakes of mica; few fine prominent strong brown (7.5YR 4/6) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; very strongly acid; clear smooth boundary. (15 to 24 inches thick)
BCg--38 to 45 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; common medium faint yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; common fine flakes of mica; strongly acid; clear smooth boundary. (6 to 12 inches thick)
Cgl--45 to 60 inches; gray (10YR 6/1) loam; massive; friable; common medium distinct light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) and few fine prominent dark reddish brown (5YR 3/4) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; common fine flakes of mica; strongly acid; clear smooth boundary.
Cg2--60 to 72 inches; olive gray (5Y 5/2) fine sandy loam; massive; friable; common medium distinct olive (5Y 5/6) and yellowish red (5YR 4/6) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; common fine flakes of mica; moderately acid.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Hyde County, North Carolina; about 1 mile west of Fairfield, about 0.9 mile west of the intersection of North Carolina Highway 94 and Secondary Road 1305, about 350 feet south of Secondary Road 1305 on a farm path, in a cultivated field.  Fairfield USGS topographic quadrangle; lat. 35 degrees 32 minutes 12 seconds N. and long. 76 degrees 14 minutes 25 seconds W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Solum Thickness: 30 to more than 60 inches
Depth to Bedrock: Greater than 60 inches
Depth to Seasonal High Water Table: 0 to 12 inches, December to March
Soil Reaction: Very strongly acid to strongly acid except where limed;
Mica Content: Few to common flakes in the lower Btg and Cg horizons
A or Ap horizon:
Color--hue of 10YR to 5Y, or is neutral, value of 2 or 3, and chroma of 0 to 2
Texture--silt loam, very fine sandy loam, or loam
AB horizon:
Color--hue of 10YR to 5Y, or is neutral, value of 2 or 3, and chroma of 0 to 2
Texture--silt loam, very fine sandy loam, or loam
Bg horizon:
Color--hue of 10YR to 5Y, or is neutral, value of 4 to 7, and chroma of 0 to 2
Texture--loam, silt loam, or very fine sandy loam. Thin layers of silty clay loam and clay loam are present in some pedons
Redoximorphic Features--iron masses in shades of yellow, brown, or red and iron depletions in shades of gray or olive
BCg horizon (if it occurs):
Color--has hue of 10YR to 5Y, or is neutral, value of 4 to 7, and chroma of 0 to 2
Texture--loam, silt loam or very fine sandy loam. Thin layers of silty clay loam and clay loam are present in some pedons
Redoximorphic Features--iron masses in shades of yellow, brown, or red and iron depletions in shades of gray or olive
2CBg or 2BCg horizon (if it occurs):
Color--hue of 10YR to 5Y, or is neutral, or is 5GY to 5BG, value of 4 to 8, and chroma of 0 to 2
Texture--sandy loam or fine sandy loam, with or without thin lenses of loamy sand, loamy fine sand or sand
Redoximorphic Features--iron masses in shades of yellow, brown, or red and iron depletions in shades of gray or olive
Cg or 2Cg horizon:
Color--hue of 10YR to 5Y, or is neutral, or is 5GY to 5BG, value of 4 to 8, and chroma of 0 to 2
Texture--loam, silt loam, fine sandy loam, sandy loam, loamy fine sand loamy sand or  sand
Redoximorphic Features--iron masses in shades of yellow, brown, or red and iron depletions in shades of gray or olive

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
There are no other known series in the same family.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Landscape: Coastal Plain
Landform: Marine Terrace
Elevation: Less than 25 feet above mean sea level
Parent Material: loamy marine sediments
Mean Annual Air Temperature: 59 to 63 degrees
Mean Annual Precipitation: 40 to 58 inches
Frost Free Period: 190 to 240 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Barclay soils--somewhat poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 12 to 18 inches) on higher landscapes
Chapanoke soils--somewhat poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 12 to 18 inches) in fine-silty family on higher landscapes
Dragston soils--somewhat poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 0 to 1 foot) in coarse-loamy family on higher landscapes
Hyde soils--very poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 0 to 12 inches) in fine-silty family on similar landscapes
Nimmo soils--poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 0 to 12 inches) in coarse-loamy family on similar landscapes
Nixonton soils--moderately well drained soils (seasonal high water table 18 to 36 inches) on slightly higher landscapes
Pasquotank soils--poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 0 to 12 inches) on flats and in depressions
Perquimans soils--poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 0 to 12 inches) on similar landscapes
Roanoke soils--poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 0 to 12 inches) in fine family on similar landscapes
Tomotley soils--poorly drained soils (seasonal high water table 0 to 12 inches) in fine-loamy family on similar landscapes

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:
Agricultural Drainage Class: Very poorly drained
Permeability: Moderate
Runoff: Slow to ponded

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Major Uses: Mostly cultivated
Dominant Vegetation: Where cultivated--corn, soybeans, wheat, cucumbers, cabbage, potatoes, and pasture. Where wooded--loblolly pine, pond pine, blackgum, green ash, sweetgum, and water oak. Understory species include large gallberry, wax myrtle (southern bayberry), inkberry (bitter gallberry), greenbrier, cane, and sweetbay.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content:
DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:
Distribution: Tidewater and lower Coastal Plain of North Carolina and Virginia
Extent: Small

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Raleigh, North Carolina

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED: Pasquotank County, North Carolina; 1951.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS: The 08/2008 revision moves the type location from Pasquotank County, North Carolina to Hyde County, North Carolina.  The pedon in Hyde County is more representative of the series concept.
Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are:
Aquic moisture regime
Umbric epipedon--the zone from the surface to a depth of 13 inches
Cambic horizon--the zone from depths of 13 to 45 inches
Contrasting layers are at depths of 45 to 72 inches.

HORIZONS.name: Ap
HORIZONS.narrative: Ap--0 to 6 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) loam; moderate medium granular structure; friable; common fine roots; very strongly acid; gradual smooth boundary. (5 to 7 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: AB
HORIZONS.narrative: AB--6 to 13 inches; very dark brown (10YR 2/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; few fine roots; very strongly acid; gradual smooth boundary. (5 to 12 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: Bg1
HORIZONS.narrative: Bg1--13 to 32 inches; dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; few fine flakes of mica; very strongly acid; gradual smooth boundary.

HORIZONS.name: Bg2
HORIZONS.narrative: Bg2--32 to 38 inches; dark grayish brown (2.5Y 4/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; few fine flakes of mica; few fine prominent strong brown (7.5YR 4/6) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; very strongly acid; clear smooth boundary. (15 to 24 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: BCg
HORIZONS.narrative: BCg--38 to 45 inches; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) loam; moderate medium subangular blocky structure; friable; common medium faint yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; common fine flakes of mica; strongly acid; clear smooth boundary. (6 to 12 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: Cgl
HORIZONS.narrative: Cgl--45 to 60 inches; gray (10YR 6/1) loam; massive; friable; common medium distinct light olive brown (2.5Y 5/4) and few fine prominent dark reddish brown (5YR 3/4) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; common fine flakes of mica; strongly acid; clear smooth boundary.

HORIZONS.name: Cg2
HORIZONS.narrative: Cg2--60 to 72 inches; olive gray (5Y 5/2) fine sandy loam; massive; friable; common medium distinct olive (5Y 5/6) and yellowish red (5YR 4/6) rounded masses of iron accumulation with clear boundaries in the matrix; common fine flakes of mica; moderately acid.
